meanings.definition: To envision or foresee something in advance.
meanings.sent1: She previsioned the outcome of the experiment before it even started.
meanings.sent2: He always previsioned the challenges that lay ahead.
meanings.sent3: The students previsioned a world where homework did itself!
meanings.sent4: Her mind previsioned a future filled with endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The psychic previsioned the events of the next day with eerie accuracy.

meanings.sent1: The previsioned results of the test were exactly as predicted.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of relief knowing her previsioned outcome came true.
meanings.sent3: The previsioned surprise party was a success, much to his delight.
meanings.sent4: His previsioned success in the competition motivated him to train harder.
meanings.sent5: The previsioned storm clouds gathered ominously on the horizon.
